Subject: English
ContextHeader: The ‘Background Information’ provided crucial information for the completion of the task.

Subject: English
ContextContent: It was here that the students were given the context in which the text was created and the identity of the text’s author and the intended audience was defined.

Subject: English
ContextHeader: Students needed to use this knowledge as well as inferred knowledge during their reading of the previously unseen persuasive text to establish the author’s purpose, the characteristics of the intended audience and the relationship between the author and the intended audience.

Subject: English
ContextContent: This information derived by inferential reading was vital for students as they demonstrated their skill in analytical thinking while completing the task.

Subject: English
ContextHeader: There was no preferred structure or content.

Subject: English
ContextContent: Students were free to adopt their own strategy to explain the ways in which the text was structured to persuade the intended audience and the ways in which language and visual language were harnessed to convey and amplify the ideas presented.

Subject: English
ContextHeader: In 2024, the students were presented with a previously unseen text about a fictional gym experiencing financial insecurity and considering a partnership with another business, which held apparently conflicting values, to secure its financial viability.

Subject: English
ContextHeader: The form was a speech made to an audience of Our Local Gym members presented at an emergency meeting.

Subject: English
ContextContent: Two slides were shown to the audience during the speech.

Subject: English
ContextContent: The Chair of the gym was Sandy Gestalt, whose purpose was to persuade the gym’s members to put aside their values for pragmatic reasons and vote in favour of the controversial partnership.

Subject: English
ContextContent: Her contention was that the values of the two businesses could be reconciled by reframing perceptions, and that such a compromise was a financial necessity.

Subject: English
ContextHeader: As in previous sections of the exam, the task was designed to allow students multiple entry points so that they could demonstrate their skills to the best of their ability.
